first class.translation[0].definitions[0: the best and most expensive seats on a plane or train, or rooms in a hotel
We prefer to travel in first class.
first class.translation[0].definitions[1: the class of post used in Britain for letters and parcels, that is quicker and more expensive than second-class post
first class.translation[0].definitions[2: the class of post used in the US for ordinary business and personal letters
first class.translation[0].definitions[3: the highest class of degree from a British university
first class.translation[1].definitions[0: of very good quality, and much better than other things of the same type
first class.translation[1].definitions[1: relating to the class of post that is the most expensive and quickest to arrive
first class.translation[1].definitions[2: relating to the best and most expensive class of seats on a plane or train, or rooms in a hotel
first class.translation[2].definitions[0: if something is first-class, it is of very good quality and much better than other things of the same type
We provide a first-class, professional service for our customers.
first class.translation[2].definitions[2: first class seats, accommodation etc are the most comfortable and expensive available
The airline claims its 9,000 daily first-class seats are 65% full.
